main_definition: In comparison to something else, 'worse' refers to a lower quality or less favorable condition.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Superior to one option but inferior to another in terms of quality, performance, etc.
meanings_and_examples.example: 'This model is worse than the previous one but better than its successor.'

meanings_and_examples.definition: Comparing two situations or events where one has a decline in conditions, status, or value
meanings_and_examples.example: 'After losing his job, John's financial situation got worse.'

meanings_and_examples.definition: A state of affairs that is not as good as it was before; a deterioration from an earlier point
meanings_and_examples.example: 'Due to the heavy rainfall last night, our roads are in worse condition than usual.'

meanings_and_examples.definition: Used to compare two things where one is less desirable or less satisfactory than the other
meanings_and_examples.example: 'The service was good yesterday but it's worse today; we had to wait for 30 minutes before being seated.'

meanings_and_examples.definition: In a broader sense, referring to any negative change in status or quality over time
meanings_and_examples.example: 'His health has been getting worse since he stopped exercising regularly.'
